item.title: 尽管加征关税，加拿大工厂和批发商 6 月份仍实现增长
item.description: 加拿大最容易受到美国贸易战影响的两个行业在第二季度销售强劲，扭转了此前关税导致的下滑趋势。【原文：Two of Canada’s most vulnerable sectors to the US trade war ended the second quarter with strong sales, reversing an earlier tariff-driven slump.】

item.title: 美国零售销售额上调后大幅增长
item.description: 受汽车销售和大型在线促销活动的推动，美国 7 月份零售销售额广泛增长，这表明近几个月来消费者加大了消费力度。【原文：US retail sales rose in July in a broad-based advance, boosted by car sales and major online promotions in a sign consumers stepped up their spending in recent months.】

item.title: 罗布斯塔咖啡将因顶级种植国的供应困境而每周跳涨
item.description: 罗布斯塔咖啡在伦敦有望创下二十多年来的最大单周涨幅，因为两大生产商对供应紧张的担忧使市场始终处于紧张状态。【原文：Robusta coffee was on track for the biggest weekly gain in more than two decades in London, as concerns over tight supplies from the two largest producers keep the market on edge.】

item.title: 尼日利亚通胀再次放缓，为降息提供依据
item.description: 尼日利亚 7 月份的年通胀率连续第四个月放缓，这为央行开始削减创历史新高的借贷成本提供了更多理由。【原文：Nigerian annual inflation slowed for a fourth consecutive month in July, strengthening the case for the central bank to begin cutting borrowing costs that are at a record high.】

item.title: 萨默林称，如果 10 年期收益率上升，美联储将需要停止缩表
item.description: 被视为美联储主席候选人的经济学家马克-萨默林（Marc Sumerlin）表示，政策制定者应在下个月降低利率，但他提醒说，如果长期国债收益率上升，政策制定者将不得不停止降息。【原文：Economist Marc Sumerlin, viewed as a candidate to chair the Federal Reserve, said policymakers should slash interest rates next month, but cautioned that they would have to stop if longer-term Treasury yields rose.】

item.title: 中国经济遭遇 2025 年最糟糕的一个月，刺激政策重新发挥作用
item.description: 中国经济在 7 月份出现了今年以来最严重的放缓，这使人们更加期待中国政府在今年推出更多刺激措施，以抵消唐纳德-特朗普贸易战的影响。【原文：China’s economy clocked its deepest slowdown of the year in July, raising expectations for Beijing to roll out more stimulus this year to offset the impact of Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 据说 Advent 将考虑收购瑞士芯片制造商 U-blox
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Advent 公司正在制定收购 U-blox Holding AG 公司的方案，这笔交易对这家瑞士定位芯片制造商的估值可能超过 10 亿瑞士法郎（约合 12 亿美元）。【原文：Advent is working on an offer to acquire U-blox Holding AG in a deal that could value the Swiss maker of positioning chips at more than 1 billion Swiss francs ($1.2 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 爱丽舍表示，马克龙和泽伦斯基将在阿拉斯加会谈后会晤
item.description: 法国总统府表示，埃马纽埃尔-马克龙总统和沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基总统将在周五阿拉斯加美俄会谈后举行会晤。【原文：Presidents Emmanuel Macron and Volodymyr Zelenskiy will hold a meeting after Friday’s US-Russia talks in Alaska, the French presidency said.】

item.title: 遗产税投票前，前皮克泰特老板离开瑞士
item.description: 在即将举行的关于增加遗产税的投票之前，瑞士的一位顶级私人银行家已经搬到了意大利。【原文：One of Switzerland’s top private bankers has moved to Italy, ahead of an upcoming vote on increasing inheritance tax.】

item.title: 加里-内维尔称美国投资者将继续收购英格兰足球俱乐部
item.description: 英格兰足球队索尔福德城的共同所有人加里-内维尔（Gary Neville）表示，美国投资者将继续投资英格兰的俱乐部。【原文：Gary Neville, co-owner of English football team Salford City, said American investors will continue to invest in the country’s clubs.】

item.title: 穆德里克说，利率上调拓宽了受困者的选择范围
item.description: 自 2009 年杰森-穆德里克（Jason Mudrick）成立他的基金穆德里克资本管理公司（Mudrick Capital Management）以来，不良债务投资领域已经发生了三大变化：私募股权在经济中扮演了更重要的角色；低利率鼓励了各行各业的高杠杆资本结构；金融文件越来越薄弱。【原文：Since 2009, when Jason Mudrick set up his fund Mudrick Capital Management, the world of distressed debt investing has seen three major changes: private equity plays a larger role in the economy, low rates have encouraged highly leveraged capital structures across sectors and there’s weaker financial documentation.】

item.title: 让奥斯特成为风电巨头的融资工具也毁了它
item.description:
丹麦开发商利用 "农场降价 "来推动增长，但价格和利率的上涨颠覆了这一模式。【原文：

The Danish developer used ‘farm downs’ to fuel growth, but rising prices and interest rates upended that model.

】

item.title: 人工智能音乐无处不在，却越来越难以发现
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，埃伦-休特（Ellen Huet）对人工智能生成的音乐进行了调查，发现其进步速度惊人。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ellen Huet checks in on AI-generated music and finds its rate of improvement striking.】

item.title: 通胀迹象为美联储决策者非同寻常的降息埋下伏笔
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济编辑。今天我们关注美国通胀前景和美联储政策。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at the outlook for US inflation and Fed policy. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: Pimco 对房利美上市的警告：不要修补没坏的东西
item.description: 太平洋投资管理公司警告说，特朗普政府出售房利美（Fannie Mae）和房地美（Freddie Mac）股份的计划可能会推高美国人支付的抵押贷款利率。【原文：Pacific Investment Management Co. is warning that the Trump administration’s plan to sell shares in Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac could drive up the mortgage rates that Americans pay.】

item.title: 主要数据显示南非国内生产总值连续三个季度增长
item.description: 受主要制造业和采矿业复苏的推动，南非经济可能连续第三个季度实现增长，尽管美国关税现在对经济增长构成了新的挑战。【原文：South Africa’s economy probably expanded for a third successive quarter, buoyed by recoveries in the key manufacturing and mining sectors, although US tariffs now pose a fresh challenge to growth.】

item.title: 小盘股在人工智能交易中远远落在后面
item.description:
小盘科技股今年跌幅达 1%，落后大盘股的幅度为历年之最。【原文：

Small-cap tech stocks fall 1% this year, lagging largecaps by the most ever. 

】

item.title: 投票为泰国大亨的 Frasers 房地产投资信托基金私有化扫清道路
item.description: 由泰国首富 Charoen Sirivadhanabhakdi 控制的 Frasers Property Ltd.（辉盛地产有限公司）扫清了将一家房地产投资信托公司私有化的关键障碍。【原文：Frasers Property Ltd., controlled by Thailand’s richest man Charoen Sirivadhanabhakdi, cleared a key hurdle in its pursuit to take private a real estate investment trust.】

item.title: 英国金融监管委员会称，ESG 贷款市场已不受 "洗绿 "影响
item.description: 英国金融行为监管局（Financial Conduct Authority）在警告与可持续发展挂钩的贷款市场存在 "洗绿 "风险两年后表示，银行和借款人似乎已经做出了有意义的改进。【原文：Two years after it warned of greenwashing risks in the market for sustainability-linked loans, the UK’s Financial Conduct Authority says banks and borrowers appear to have made meaningful improvements.】

item.title: 惠誉评级警告越南推动增长可能引发债务风险
item.description: 据惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）称，越南大力推动经济快速增长的政策决定可能导致本已高企的债务水平进一步恶化，从而增加该国信用评级和国内银行健康状况的风险。【原文：Vietnam’s strong push for rapid economic growth could lead to policy decisions that worsen already high debt levels, increasing risks to the country’s credit rating and the health of domestic banks, according to Fitch Ratings.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚 2026 年预算：消费股和能源股成为赢家
item.description: 印尼总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）希望加快东南亚最大经济体的增长速度，因此印尼的消费和矿业公司将从该国明年3790亿卢比（约合2340亿美元）的支出计划中获益。【原文：Indonesia’s consumer and mining firms are set to benefit from the country’s 3.79 quadrillion rupiah ($234 billion) spending plan next year as President Prabowo Subianto aims to accelerate growth in Southeast Asia’s largest economy.】

item.title: 中国向 WTO 提出钢铁诉讼加剧加拿大贸易争端
item.description: 中国加深了与加拿大的贸易争端，在对加拿大油菜籽征收新的关税几天后，又就钢铁进口限制问题向世界贸易组织提起诉讼。【原文：China deepened a trade spat with Canada, filing a lawsuit at the World Trade Organization over import restrictions on steel just days after slapping fresh duties on Canadian canola.】

item.title: 荷兰国际集团警告荷兰养老金改革将导致欧元汇率波动
item.description: 欧洲利率市场一角的波动性正在上升，从中可以窥见未来几个月荷兰养老金制度重大改革的潜在影响。【原文：Volatility in a corner of the European rates markets is on the rise, offering a glimpse into the potential impact of a major overhaul of the Dutch pension system in the coming months.】

item.title: Meta 的消费者人工智能应用在发布数月后仍存在缺陷
item.description:
Meta人工智能应用提供的体验参差不齐，与马克-扎克伯格高远的人工智能雄心形成了鲜明对比。【原文：

The Meta AI app offers an uneven experience, posing a sharp contrast to Mark Zuckerberg’s lofty artificial intelligence ambitions.

】

item.title: 乌克兰袭击俄罗斯炼油厂，特朗普和普京将会晤
item.description: 就在弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）和唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）准备于周五在阿拉斯加会晤，讨论可能的停火协议之际，乌克兰又袭击了一家俄罗斯炼油厂。【原文：Ukraine attacked another Russian refinery just as Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump are poised to meet in Alaska on Friday to discuss a potential ceasefire.】

item.title: 人工智能加剧科技股分化，小型股萎靡不振
item.description: 争夺人工智能财富所需的巨额支出拉大了大型和小型科技股之间的业绩差距。【原文：The massive outlays required to compete for artificial intelligence riches have widened the performance gap between large and small tech shares.】

item.title: 坐享巨大收益的 CoreWeave IPO 投资者有机会卖出
item.description: CoreWeave 公司 3 月份的首次公开募股对于有幸在一开始就参与其中的人来说取得了巨大成功。到 6 月中旬，股价上涨了四倍多。即使在最近的大跌之后，股价仍上涨了近 150%。【原文：CoreWeave Inc.’s March initial public offering has been a roaring success for anyone lucky enough to get in at the start. The stock more than quadrupled by mid-June. Even after a recent selloff, the shares are still up nearly 150%.】

item.title: 阿波罗欧洲信贷主管关注国防和人工智能领域的交易
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.）欧洲信贷联席主管特里斯特拉姆-利奇（Tristram Leach）在接受彭博电视采访时表示，该公司的目标是在欧洲投资人工智能、国防和基础设施，因为欧洲需要数万亿美元的支出。【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc. is aiming to invest in artificial intelligence, defense and infrastructure in Europe, where trillions in spending is needed, its co-head of European credit Tristram Leach said in a Bloomberg TV interview.】

item.title: 美国银行哈特内特认为杰克逊霍尔会议后股市将出现获利回吐
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp.）的策略师表示，美股破纪录的涨势使其成为获利回吐的黄金地段，以防美联储在杰克逊霍尔经济研讨会上发出鸽派信号。【原文：The record-breaking rally in US stocks has left them prime for profit taking in the event of dovish signals from the Federal Reserve at the Jackson Hole economic symposium, according to Bank of America Corp. strategists.】

item.title: 九一集团的斯托福德称美国是市场风险的中心
item.description: 九一资产管理公司（Ninety One Asset Management）的约翰-斯托福德（John Stopford）正在削减股票和高风险债务的投资，认为自满的市场没有为唐纳德-特朗普总统的政策可能导致的美国资产大跌做好准备。【原文：Ninety One Asset Management’s John Stopford is trimming his exposure to stocks and riskier debt, arguing that complacent markets are failing to prepare for a potential selloff in US assets driven by President Donald Trump’s policies.】
